meta.name: enterprise_org
meta.description: A mature enterprise organization with multiple teams, repos, and established knowledge

memos.content: Acme Corp is a B2B SaaS company founded in 2015. We build enterprise software for supply chain management. Our main products are SupplyFlow (inventory tracking) and LogiSync (logistics coordination).
The Platform Team is responsible for our core infrastructure. They maintain the shared services like authentication, API gateway, and observability. Sarah Chen leads the team.
The SupplyFlow Team builds our flagship inventory management product. Marcus Williams is the tech lead. They use React for the frontend and Go for backend microservices.
The LogiSync Team handles logistics coordination features. Led by Priya Patel. They recently migrated from a monolith to microservices architecture.
DECISION: All teams must use the shared authentication service (platform-auth) rather than implementing their own auth. This ensures consistent security practices across products.
DECISION: We're standardizing on PostgreSQL for relational data and Redis for caching. Each service should use these unless there's a documented exception approved by the Platform Team.
The shared-libs repository contains common utilities used across all products. It includes logging helpers, error handling, and API client generators. Platform Team maintains it.
We use trunk-based development with short-lived feature branches. All merges require at least one approval and passing CI. Feature flags are preferred over long-running branches.
Security review is required for any changes to authentication, authorization, or data handling. The security-checklist.md in each repo documents what needs review.
Alex Kim joined as a senior engineer on the SupplyFlow Team last month. Previously worked at Amazon on their inventory systems. Bringing expertise in distributed systems.
